code: @Manual{,   title = {covid19br: Brazilian COVID-19 Pandemic Data},   author = {Fábio N. Demarqui and Cristiano C. Santos and Matheus B. Costa},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.4},   url = {https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=covid19br}, }

title: Brazilian COVID-19 Pandemic Data
text: goal package provide function automatically import Brazilian COVID-19 pandemic data R. Brazilian data available country, region, state, city levels, downloaded official Brazilian repository <https://covid.saude.gov.br/>. package also enables one download world-level COVID-19 data Johns Hopkins University’s repository <https://github.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19>.

title: Brazilian COVID-19 Pandemic Data
text: can install released version covid19br CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: Brazilian COVID-19 Pandemic Data
text: Downloading COVID-19 pandemic data:
code: library(covid19br) library(tidyverse)  brazil <- downloadCovid19("brazil") regions <- downloadCovid19("regions") states <- downloadCovid19("states") cities <- downloadCovid19("cities") world <- downloadCovid19("world")

text: World map: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=rnaturalearthdata Shapefiles Brazilian maps: https://www.ibge.gov.br/geociencias/downloads-geociencias.html Brazilian DHI data: https://github.com/ipea/IpeaGeo

title: Adding the geometry to the downloaded data for drawing maps — add_geo
text: data data set downloaded using covid19br::downloadCovid19() function. ... arguments passed methods.

title: Adding the geometry to the downloaded data for drawing maps — add_geo
text: data set added georeferenced data.

title: Adding the geometry to the downloaded data for drawing maps — add_geo
text: function add_geo() designed work original names variables available dataset downloaded covid19br::downloadCovid19(). reason, function must used changes original names variables. development human index (DHI) variables (see full description ) available city level, average computed state region levels. Data dictionary (Brazilian data): region: regions' names state: states' names. city: cities' names. DHI: development human index. EDHI: educational development human index. LDHI: longevity development human index. IDHI: income development human index. pop: estimated population 2019. region_code: numerical code attributed regions state_code: numerical code attributed states mesoregion_code: numerical code attributed mesoregions microregion_code: numerical code attributed microregions city_code: numerical code attributed cities geometry: georeferenced data needed plot maps. area: area (Km^2) demoDens: demographic density. Data dictionary (world data): country: country's name continent: continent's name region: regions' names subregion: subregion's name pop: estimated population pais: country's name Portuguese country_code: numerical code attributed countries continent_code: numerical code attributed continents region_code: numerical code attributed regions subregion_code: numerical code attributed subregions geometry: georeferenced data needed plot maps.

title: Adding the geometry to the downloaded data for drawing maps — add_geo
text: Fabio N. Demarqui fndemarqui@est.ufmg.br

title: Adding the geometry to the downloaded data for drawing maps — add_geo
Brazilian COVID-19 Pandemic Data. — covid19br
text: package provides function automatically import  Brazilian CODID-19 pandemic data R. Brazilian data available country, region, state, city levels, obtained official Brazilian repository <https://covid.saude.gov.br/>. package also downloads world-level COVID-19 data John Hopkins University's repository <https://github.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19>.

title: Brazilian COVID-19 Pandemic Data. — covid19br
text: Fábio N. Demarqui, Cristiano C. Santos, Matheus B. Costa. _PACKAGE

what: Function to download COVID-19 data from web repositories — downloadCovid19
title: Function to download COVID-19 data from web repositories — downloadCovid19
text: function downloads pandemic COVID-19 data Brazil World levels. Brazilian data available national, region, state, city levels, whereas world data available country level.

title: Function to download COVID-19 data from web repositories — downloadCovid19
Function to download COVID-19 data from web repositories — downloadCovid19
text: level desired level data aggregation:  "brazil" (default), "regions", "states", "cities", "world".

title: Function to download COVID-19 data from web repositories — downloadCovid19
text: tibble containing downloaded data specified level.

title: Function to download COVID-19 data from web repositories — downloadCovid19
text: Data dictionary (variables commum brazilian world data): date: date data registry epi_week: epidemiological week pop: estimated population accumCases: accumulative number confirmed cases newCases: daily count new confirmed cases accumDeaths: accumulative number deaths newDeaths: daily count new deaths newRecovered: daily count new recovered patients Data dictionary (variables brazilian data): region: regions' names state: states' names. city: cities' names. state_code: numerical code attributed states city_code: numerical code attributed cities healthRegion_code: health region code healthRegion: heald region name newFollowup: daily count new patients follow metro_area: indicator variable city localized metropolitan area capital: indicator variable capital brazilian states Data dictionary (variables world data): country: countries' names accumRecovered: accumulative number recovered patients

title: Function to download COVID-19 data from web repositories — downloadCovid19
code: # \donttest{ library(covid19br)  # Downloading Brazilian COVID-19 data: brazil <- downloadCovid19(level = "brazil") #> Downloading COVID-19 data... please, be patient! regions <- downloadCovid19(level = "regions") #> Downloading COVID-19 data... please, be patient! states <- downloadCovid19(level = "states") #> Downloading COVID-19 data... please, be patient! cities <- downloadCovid19(level = "cities") #> Downloading COVID-19 data... please, be patient!  # Downloading world COVID-19 data: world <- downloadCovid19(level = "world") #> Downloading COVID-19 data... please, be patient! # }

what: Results of the 2018 presidential election in Brazil by city. — election2018Cities
title: Results of the 2018 presidential election in Brazil by city. — election2018Cities
text: Dataset containing results 2018 presidential election Brazil.

title: Results of the 2018 presidential election in Brazil by city. — election2018Cities
text: data frame 5570 rows 6 variables: region: regions' names state: states' names. city: cities' names. region_code: numerical code attributed regions state_code: numerical code attributed states mesoregion_code: numerical code attributed mesoregions microregion_code: numerical code attributed microregions city_code: numerical code attributed cities Bolsonaro: count votes obtained President-elected Jair Bolosnaro. Haddad: count votes obtained defeated candidate Fernando Haddad. pop: estimated population 2019.

title: Results of the 2018 presidential election in Brazil by city. — election2018Cities
text: Tribunal Superior Eleitoral (TSE). URL:  https://www.tse.jus.br/eleicoes/estatisticas.

title: City-level georeferenced data — geocities
text: Data set obtained Instituto Brasileiro de Geografia e Estatística (IBGE) data Brazilian population geographical information city level.

title: City-level georeferenced data — geocities
text: data frame 5570 rows 16 variables: region: regions' names state: states' names. city: cities' names. DHI: development human index. EDHI: educational development human index. LDHI: longevity development human index. IDHI: income development human index. pop: estimated population 2019. region_code: numerical code attributed regions state_code: numerical code attributed states mesoregion_code: numerical code attributed mesoregions microregion_code: numerical code attributed microregions city_code: numerical code attributed cities geometry: georeferenced data needed plot maps. area: area (Km^2) pop_dens: demographic density.

title: City-level georeferenced data — geocities
text: Shapefiles Brazilian maps: https://www.ibge.gov.br/geociencias/downloads-geociencias.html Brazilian DHI data: https://github.com/ipea/IpeaGeo

title: covid19br 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-11-24 Inclusion informative message downloadCovid19 function notify user data temporarily unavailable.

title: covid19br 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-08 Development package’s webpage (https://fndemarqui.github.io/covid19br/) Inclusion 2 vignettes showing use package. Implementation add_epi_rates() function add epidemiological rates (incidence, mortality lethatity) downloaded data. Implementation add_geo() function add georeferenced data downloaded COVID19 data. Addition georeferenced data Brazil (city, state region levels) world (country level). Lubridate package removed Imports field DESCRIPTION file.

title: covid19br 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-17 Addition datasets 2018 Brazilian presidential election results city, state regional levels. Georeferenced data removed package made available fly calling function add_geo(). Documentation update Update vignettes

title: covid19br 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-30 Removing vignettes maps.Rmd election2018.Rmd

title: covid19br 0.1.5
text: CRAN release: 2023-05-08 Reinclusion vignettes maps.Rmd election2018.Rmd

title: covid19br 0.1.6
text: CRAN release: 2023-07-04 Removing vignette maps.Rmd

title: covid19br 0.1.7
text: CRAN release: 2023-09-05 Adding @aliases covid19br-package documentation requested CRAN team.

title: covid19br 0.1.8
text: CRAN release: 2023-10-15 vignettes removed.

title: covid19br 1.0.0
text: Download function completely rewriten. COVID-19 data available May 5, 2023, longer updated.
